channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Christmas in the City
item.description:
Sunday, December 1, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Christmas in the City.

Experience the magic of Christmas when Brisbane's iconic City Hall is transformed into a vibrant display of captivating visuals, festive sounds and a heart-warming story for the whole family to enjoy.
This year's enchanting story, Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue, invites you on a magical adventure as Santa's sleigh crash-lands in Brisbane. In response to Santa's call for help, a group of friendly Aussie bush animals come to the rescue, gathering local ingredients for gingerbread dough to refuel the sleigh and deliver presents all around the world.
City Hall Lights runs every 15 minutes from 7.30pm to midnight, from 6-24 December.
Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue written by Brisbane-based author, Rebecca Sheraton

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: World AIDS Day
item.description:
Sunday, December 1, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Red to support World AIDS Day.

Queensland Positive People (QPP), is a peer-led, community-based organisation committed to improving the lives of all people living with HIV and help reduce new transmissions of HIV and other STIs across Queensland.
With the support of Queensland Health, QPP delivers the World AIDS Day awareness campaign in Queensland, and supports the Queensland Council of LGBTI Health to deliver the vigils and remembrances in Brisbane and across Queensland.
World AIDS Day is held on 1 December each year globally and raises awareness across the world and in the community about the issues surrounding HIV and AIDS. It is a day for people to show their support for people living with HIV and to commemorate people who have been lost to the epidemic here in Queensland, and further afield.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Positive People Inc.

Light up asset: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
Venue type: Light up asset, Park

item.title: Disability Action Week
item.description:
Monday, December 2, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue, Green and Orange to support Disability Action Week.

Disability Action Week is a chance to reflect on our progress and look at what we can all do to build a more accessible and inclusive community.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

item.title: International Day of Persons with Disabilities
item.description:
Tuesday, December 3, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue, Green and Orange to support International Day of Persons with Disabilities.

International Day of People with Disability is held on 3 December each year, and is a United Nations observed day aimed at increasing public awareness, understanding and acceptance of people with disability.
It's a day to celebrate the achievements and contributions of people with disability. This year’s theme: “Amplifying the leadership of persons with disabilities for an inclusive and sustainable future.”
This theme recognizes the important role that persons with disabilities play in creating a more inclusive and sustainable world for all. It also emphasizes the importance of the participation of persons with disabilities in decision-making processes that affect their lives.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Wednesday, December 4, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal.

For more than 70 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grants where charities apply to help vital community services and grassroots initiatives, particularly at Christmas.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Christmas in the City.
Experience the magic of Christmas when Brisbane's iconic City Hall is transformed into a vibrant display of captivating visuals, festive sounds and a heart-warming story for the whole family to enjoy. This year's enchanting story, Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue, invites you on a magical adventure as Santa's sleigh crash-lands in Brisbane. In response to Santa's call for help, a group of friendly Aussie bush animals come to the rescue, gathering local ingredients for gingerbread dough to refuel the sleigh and deliver presents all around the world. City Hall Lights runs every 15 minutes from 7.30pm to midnight, from 6-24 December. Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue written by Brisbane-based author, Rebecca Sheraton
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency
item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Thursday, December 5, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal.

For more than 70 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grants where charities apply to help vital community services and grassroots initiatives, particularly at Christmas.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Christmas in the City
item.description:
Friday, December 6, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Christmas in the City.

Brisbane comes alive this December with plenty of free and low-cost Christmas festivities ideal for the whole family.
Join us for the Lighting of the Christmas Tree, sing along to your favourite Christmas tunes at the Lord Mayor's Christmas Carols or drop by the Queen Street Mall for pop-up entertainment and roaming performances.
For more information about Christmas in the heart of Brisbane, visit the Visit Brisbane website.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: Human Rights Week
item.description:
Tuesday, December 10, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Orange to support Human Rights Week.

Human Rights Week is an annual celebration which takes place every year to promote awareness and understanding of the importance of human rights. Human Rights Week begins on 1 December each year, culminating on Human Rights Day on 10 December.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Human Rights Commission.

item.title: Christmas in the City
item.description:
Friday, December 13, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Christmas in the City.

Experience the magic of Christmas when Brisbane's iconic City Hall is transformed into a vibrant display of captivating visuals, festive sounds and a heart-warming story for the whole family to enjoy.
This year's enchanting story, Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue, invites you on a magical adventure as Santa's sleigh crash-lands in Brisbane. In response to Santa's call for help, a group of friendly Aussie bush animals come to the rescue, gathering local ingredients for gingerbread dough to refuel the sleigh and deliver presents all around the world.
City Hall Lights runs every 15 minutes from 7.30pm to midnight, from 6-24 December.
Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue written by Brisbane-based author, Rebecca Sheraton

item.title: Christmas in the City
item.description:
Wednesday, December 18, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Christmas in the City.

Experience the magic of Christmas when Brisbane's iconic City Hall is transformed into a vibrant display of captivating visuals, festive sounds and a heart-warming story for the whole family to enjoy.
This year's enchanting story, Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue, invites you on a magical adventure as Santa's sleigh crash-lands in Brisbane. In response to Santa's call for help, a group of friendly Aussie bush animals come to the rescue, gathering local ingredients for gingerbread dough to refuel the sleigh and deliver presents all around the world.
City Hall Lights runs every 15 minutes from 7.30pm to midnight, from 6-24 December.
Santa’s SOS: A Christmas Rescue written by Brisbane-based author, Rebecca Sheraton

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset
